title: Add performance benchmarks

title: GREEN: Add server.ts WebSocket explicit tests

title: GREEN: Add error classes explicit tests

title: Split cli.ts into separate command modules
description:
src/cli.ts is 730+ lines and handles multiple commands:
- init
- generate
- watch

Split into:
- src/cli/index.ts (main entry, arg parsing)
- src/cli/init.ts
- src/cli/generate.ts
- src/cli/watch.ts
- src/cli/utils.ts (shared helpers)

title: Modularize ws-advanced.ts
description: Split ws-advanced.ts (800+ lines) into sub-modules: connection.ts, heartbeat.ts, reconnection.ts, auth.ts. Keep public API unchanged.

title: Create Next.js starter template
description: Create a starter template repository for Next.js with rpc.do integration. Include: app router setup, typed RPC client, example API routes.

title: Add createRPCClient factory function
description: Add createRPCClient(options) factory function that creates an RPC client with baseUrl, headers, fetch, timeout, and retry options. This is what SDK codegen expects to import. Should wrap the existing RPC() + http() pattern into a simpler factory.

title: Add CLI watch mode
description: Add 'npx rpc.do watch' command that watches for schema changes and auto-regenerates types. Use chokidar or similar.

title: Add RateLimitError class
description: Add RateLimitError class to src/errors.ts for 429 responses. Should include retryAfter field (from Retry-After header). Export from rpc.do/errors. Used by SDK codegen for typed error handling.

title: Replace any with unknown in public APIs
description:
TypeScript review found excessive use of \`any\`:

1. src/index.ts:29 - RPCFunction uses any defaults
2. src/expose.ts:59-62 - MethodImpl uses any[]
3. src/worker.ts:24 - dispatch uses any[]
4. core/src/index.ts:78 - auth uses any
5. core/src/index.ts:53 - env uses any

Replace with \`unknown\` or proper type constraints for better type safety.

title: Add AuthenticationError class
description: Add AuthenticationError class to src/errors.ts for 401 responses. Should extend Error with message, include HTTP status code. Export from rpc.do/errors. Used by SDK codegen for typed error handling.

title: GREEN: Add capnweb transport tests
description: Add tests for capnweb() transport in src/transports.ts (lines 166-204, 0% coverage). Test: lazy-load capnweb module, WebSocket session by default, HTTP batch session when websocket:false, session disposal on close(), method navigation through proxy

title: Add concurrent/stress tests
description: Add stress tests for concurrent RPC calls (100+ parallel). Test: connection pooling, memory cleanup, no request loss under load.

title: Update SDK codegen to use ConnectionError
description: SDK codegen currently expects NetworkError but rpc.do has ConnectionError. Either: (a) add NetworkError as alias for ConnectionError, or (b) update SDK codegen to use ConnectionError. Prefer (b) for consistency.

title: Add memory leak tests
description: Add tests verifying cleanup on errors, timeouts, and connection close. Verify pendingRequests Map cleanup, timeout clearing, event listener removal.

title: Fix race condition in transport factory
description:
Location: src/index.ts:103-115

The getTransport() function has a race condition:
```typescript
if (_transportPromise) return _transportPromise
// ... later
_transportPromise = Promise.resolve(transport())
_transport = await _transportPromise
_transportPromise = null  // Clears while others might be awaiting
```

This could cause multiple factory invocations if getTransport() is called concurrently before the first promise resolves.

Fix: Use proper singleton pattern with locking, don't clear the promise until after all waiters resolve.

title: Write tRPC migration guide
description: Create migration guide from tRPC to rpc.do. Cover: conceptual differences, code transformations, transport options, type system comparison.

title: Add discriminated union for ServerMessage
description: In transports.ts, change ServerMessage from loose type to discriminated union: { id?: number; result: unknown; error?: never } | { id?: number; result?: never; error: unknown }

title: Create example: Dashboard with multiple transports
description: Create example showing composite transport usage - HTTP with WebSocket fallback. Include: real-time updates, auth integration.

title: GREEN: Add CLI module tests
description: Add comprehensive tests for src/cli.ts (261 lines, 0% coverage). Test: main() command parsing, loadConfig() for do.config.ts, fetchSchema() HTTP fetch + validation, generateClient() TypeScript generation, error handling for missing config/invalid schema/network failures

title: Add tests for binding and composite transports
description:
Missing test coverage:

1. binding() transport - no tests at all
   - Should test method navigation
   - Should test namespace access
   - Should test error cases (non-existent method, non-function property)

2. composite() transport - no tests at all
   - Should test fallback behavior
   - Should test first-success-wins
   - Should test all-fail scenario
   - Should test close() on all transports

Create tests/binding.test.ts and tests/composite.test.ts

title: CRITICAL: Unify transports to use capnweb protocol
description:
Current state has incompatible protocols:
- Client `ws()`, `wsAdvanced()` use custom JSON-RPC: `{ id, method: 'do', path, args }`
- Server `DurableRPC` uses capnweb's `RpcSession`
- These are INCOMPATIBLE

Solution:
1. Remove `ws()` basic transport - use capnweb's `newWebSocketRpcSession()` directly
2. Create `ReconnectingWebSocketTransport` implementing capnweb's `RpcTransport` interface
   - Reconnection with exponential backoff
   - Heartbeat ping/pong
   - First-message authentication
   - Message queuing during disconnection
3. Remove `wsAdvanced()` custom protocol implementation
4. Keep `capnweb()` as simple wrapper
5. Everything uses capnweb's `RpcSession` for protocol

Architecture after fix:
- Client: ReconnectingWebSocketTransport → RpcSession
- Server: HibernatableWebSocketTransport → RpcSession
- One protocol everywhere

title: CRITICAL: Refactor DurableRPC to use capnweb RpcTarget with HibernatableWebSocketTransport
description:
Current DurableRPC implements its own JSON-RPC protocol instead of using capnweb. This is wrong.

## Problem
- DurableRPC claims 'capnweb-compatible' but doesn't use capnweb at all
- Missing capnweb features: promise pipelining, bidirectional RPC, object capabilities
- Duplicating work that capnweb already does

## Solution
1. DurableRPC should extend capnweb's RpcTarget (methods exposed via RPC)
2. Create HibernatableWebSocketTransport implementing RpcTransport:
   - send(message): Use ws.send()
   - receive(): Promise that resolves on webSocketMessage
   - abort(): Close connection
3. Use ctx.acceptWebSocket() for hibernation
4. webSocketMessage/webSocketClose/webSocketError handlers feed the transport
5. Use capnweb's RpcSession for actual RPC handling

## RpcTransport interface
```typescript
interface RpcTransport {
  send(message: string): Promise<void>;
  receive(): Promise<string>;
  abort?(reason: any): void;
}
```

## Benefits
- Full capnweb protocol support
- Promise pipelining (call methods on unresolved promises)
- Bidirectional RPC
- Object capability security
- Hibernation for cost savings

title: Add security blocklist for property access
description:
Location: src/transports.ts:147-166

Path traversal in binding transport could access dangerous properties:
- __proto__
- constructor
- prototype

Add a blocklist to prevent accessing these properties via RPC.

```typescript
const BLOCKED_PROPS = new Set(['__proto__', 'constructor', 'prototype'])
if (BLOCKED_PROPS.has(parts[i])) {
  throw new RPCError('Access denied', 'FORBIDDEN')
}
```

title: Create example: Todo CRUD app
description: Create a working example application demonstrating HTTP transport with Service Bindings. Include: CRUD operations, typed client, simple UI.

title: Write Getting Started guide
description: Write a beginner-friendly quick start guide: 5-minute setup, first RPC call, step-by-step first project, common patterns. Add to README or separate GETTING_STARTED.md

title: HTTP transport should throw appropriate error types
description:
Location: src/transports.ts:120-125

Currently 401 and 429 responses throw generic RPCError:
```typescript
if (!res.ok) {
  const error = await res.text()
  throw new RPCError(error || \`HTTP \${res.status}\`, String(res.status))
}
```

Should throw:
- 401 → AuthenticationError
- 429 → RateLimitError
- Other 4xx → RPCError
- 5xx → RPCError with appropriate code

title: Extract shared MockWebSocket test utility
description: Create tests/fixtures/mocks.ts with shared MockWebSocket class. Currently duplicated in ws-basic.test.ts and ws-timeout.test.ts. Include: MockWebSocketPair, event simulation helpers.

4. createWorker() with real request handling
5. DurableRPC with actual WebSocket messages

Create tests/integration/ directory with proper setup.

description: HTTP and basic WS transports throw plain Error instead of RPCError

title: CLI generate should produce typed output, not any
description:
Current CLI generates untyped methods:
```typescript
hello(...args: any[]): Promise<any>
```

This defeats the purpose of type safety. Should generate:
```typescript
hello(name: string): Promise<string>
```

Need to either:
1. Enhance schema to include parameter/return types
2. Use TypeScript compiler API to extract types from source

title: Add middleware/interceptor support
description:
Architectural review identified lack of middleware support for cross-cutting concerns.

Add middleware pattern:
```typescript
type Middleware = (ctx: { method: string; args: unknown[] }, next: () => Promise<unknown>) => Promise<unknown>

const rpc = RPC(transport, {
  middleware: [loggingMiddleware, cachingMiddleware]
})
```

Use cases:
- Logging
- Caching
- Request transformation
- Error handling
- Metrics

title: Consolidate duplicate type definitions
description:
Multiple types are defined in multiple places:

1. ServerMessage:
   - src/transports.ts:23-25
   - src/transports/ws-advanced/types.ts:36-38

2. AuthProvider:
   - src/auth.ts:12
   - src/transports.ts:45

3. Schema types (RpcSchema, RpcMethodSchema, RpcNamespaceSchema):
   - src/cli.ts:25-40
   - core/src/index.ts:524-557

Create a shared types file or package to eliminate duplication.
